
1. Build the redis-base 4.0.14 UBI 7 Image (Use the Dockerfile from redis-base-4.0.14-ubi7 folder)

	$ docker build -t redis-base:4.0.14-ubi7.7 .
	....
	$

2. Build ap-redis image using redis-base 4.0.14 UBI 7 Image (Use the Dockerfile from redis-4.0.14-ubi7 folder)
	
	$ docker build -t ap-redis:test .
	....
	$


3. Test run the ap-redis-test UBI image

	a) Start Redis test server and verify the container running in the docker

		$ docker run --name ap-redis-test -d ap-redis:test
		1df818b9fc10788956dc16c153acfc9c341375cc1507e7ae083ccecdb44df76d
		$ 

		$ docker container ls
		CONTAINER ID        IMAGE                     COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
		1df818b9fc10        ap-redis:test            "docker-entrypoint.sâ€¦"   7 seconds ago       Up 6 seconds        6379/tcp            ap-redis-test
		$ 

	b) Get the IP Address of the redis server container.

		$ docker inspect --format '{{ .NetworkSettings.IPAddress }}' ap-redis-test
		172.17.0.4
		$ 

	c) Start Redis CLI to connect to the Redis server. 

		$ docker run -it --rm ap-redis:test redis-cli -h 172.17.0.4
		172.17.0.4:6379> set name Jay
		OK
		172.17.0.4:6379> get name
		"Jay"
		172.17.0.4:6379> exit
		$
